description.summary: protocol to announce keybinding bindings and status

protocol.description:
This protocol exposes interfaces to obtain the currently available keybindings as well as if a keybinding is currently being entered.
Warning! The protocol described in this file is experimental and backward incompatible changes may be made. Backward compatible changes may be added together with the corresponding interface version bump. Backward incompatible changes are done by bumping the version number in the protocol and interface names and resetting the interface version. Once the protocol is to be declared stable, the 'z' prefix and the version number in the protocol and interface names are removed and the interface version number is reset.

interface.name: zhrt_keybinding_state_v1
interface.description: This interface announce when the state of the currently pressed keybinding changes, as well as when the set of all available bindings changes.

event.name: state

description.summary: Announce the state of an in-progress keybinding

event.description: Announce the state of the currently pressed keybinding. The value is the pretty-printed state of the bindings, i.e. "C-t g".

event.name: bindings_changed

description.summary: Announce that the set of available keybindings has been updated

event.description: Announce the current set of available bindings.
